body.p: To his Excellency Bariah Magoffin Governor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of caldwell county Kentucky, have long known Thomas B. Wadlington and he has ever been considered a good and true harted citizen Known and noted for his industry and good and orderly conduct The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A Cartwright did not appear to us, to be of his own seeking, nor are we satisfied that the case was presented to the Jury, as it really occurred, We hope your Excellency will review the case and give the poor man the benefit of any doubt, We desire that his case may be judged in mercy and and regarded with favor and that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance that ought to operate in his behalf, and we desire that your Excellency may and will be persuaded that it is consistant with your duty to extend to him Executive clemency and that his life may be spared, either by a full pardon or by a commutation of his punishment Yours respectfully

James Robertson
J. A. Childress
T T Robertson
J, H, Hartigan
D C Hartigan
C. H. Solomon
Washington Carney
John F Baker
A, B, Quisenberry
S. D. Lester
Abreham Wise
W. F. Fowler
G. W Lester
Wm Watson
Henry
J, W, White
E, H, Porauge
C B Martin
R W Pickering
H, W, Cooksey
W H martin
B. F, Cantrell
The affiant Bradford F. Cantrell says he was present & saw the above named persons sign the foregoing petition.
Sworn to before me by Bradford F Cantrell this January 26 1861
Wm Carter J P C C
